name: Titanium.UI.ImageView
summary: A view to display a single image or series of animated images.

events.name: change
events.summary: Fired for each frame change during an animation.

properties.name: index
properties.summary: Index of the image frame being displayed.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: load
events.summary: Fired when either the initial image and/or all of the images in an animation are loaded.

properties.name: state
properties.summary: Set to image when the image defined in the image property is loaded. Set to images, when the series of images defined in the images property are loaded.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: error
events.summary: Fired when an image fails to load.

properties.name: success
properties.summary: Indicates a successful operation. Returns false.

properties.name: error
properties.summary: Error message, if any returned. May be undefined.

properties.name: code
properties.summary: Error code. If the error was generated by the operating system, that system's error value is used. Otherwise, this value will be -1.

properties.name: image
properties.summary: URL of the image that failed to load.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

methods.name: pause
methods.summary: Pauses a running animation. Use resume method to continue.
methods.description: This method only works if multiple images are specified.

methods.name: resume
methods.description: This method only works if multiple images are specified.

methods.name: start
methods.summary: Starts the image animation. On Android, also resets index to the first image.
methods.description: This method only works if multiple images are specified.

methods.name: stop
methods.summary: Stops a running animation. On iOS, also resets index to the first image.
methods.description: This method only works if multiple images are specified.

methods.name: toBlob
methods.summary: Returns the image as a Blob object.

properties.name: animating
properties.summary: Indicates whether animation is running.
properties.default: false on creation, true on load (Android), false (iPhone, iPad)

properties.name: autorotate
properties.summary: Indicates whether the image should be rotated based on exif orientation data. By default, this is false on android and true on iOS.
properties.default: false on android, true on iOS.

properties.name: decodeRetries
properties.summary: Number of times to retry decoding the bitmap at a URL.

properties.name: defaultImage
properties.summary: Local path to the default image to display while loading a remote image.

properties.name: duration
properties.summary: Amount of time in milliseconds to animate one cycle.
properties.description:
Starting with release 2.1.1, the minimum duration is 30 ms and the default duration is 200 ms.

On Android, prior to release 2.1.1, if any images are assigned to the images property when the animation is started, duration will be set to the number of images multiplied by 33 ms. If no images are assigned, duration will be set to 100 ms.

On iOS, prior to release 2.1.1, the default is 30 ms.

On Android, if the value of duration is changed, stop and start need to be called for the new value to take effect.
properties.default: 200 ms in Release 2.1.1 and later. Platform-specific default in earlier releases.

properties.name: enableZoomControls
properties.summary: Show zoom controls when the user touches the image view.

properties.name: hires
properties.summary: Set to true to prevent scaling of 2x/3x-resolution remote images for retina displays.
properties.description: Causes images to display at 50%, where one pixel of the graphic maps to one physical pixel on-screen. This functionality is automatically determined for local images via their filenames, and thus this property is only applicable to remote images.

properties.name: image
properties.summary: Image to display.
properties.description:
Image to display, defined using a local filesystem path, a File object, a remote URL, or a Blob object containing image data.

For Android, if there is a redirect and change in protocol, it will not follow. For example, from http to https and vice versa. See Java Bug Database for more information.

properties.name: images
properties.summary:
Array of images to animate, defined using local filesystem paths, File objects, remote URLs (Android only), or Blob objects containing image data.

When using this property, an initial start() needs to be called upon the ImageView before any image will show in this imageview.

Related properties/methods to look at: start, stop, pause, reverse, resume and repeatCount

properties.name: paused
properties.summary: Indicates whether the animation is paused.

properties.name: preventDefaultImage
properties.summary: Prevent the default image from being displayed while loading a remote image. This property is ignored when the defaultImage property is set.

properties.name: repeatCount
properties.summary: Number of times to repeat the image animation.

properties.name: reverse
properties.summary: Run the animation in reverse.

properties.name: tintColor
properties.summary: The view's tintColor. Android does not support setting instances of Titanium.UI.Color
properties.description: This property is a direct correspondant of the tintColor property of UIView on iOS. If no value is specified, the tintColor of the View is inherited from its superview.
